title: Bug 131649: Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
description: When constructing an expression using a 2-level table to list offices and their employees, the designer generates an incorrect column reference expression. For example, an expression like `row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]` will not run properly. The user should be able to double click on the "COUNTRY" column and have the expression automatically insert `rows[0]["COUNTRY"]`. The index `0` refers to the 0-based index of the nested table containing the data set (0 for the outermost table, 1 for the first level inner table, etc.).
OB: The designer generates an incorrect column reference expression for inner tables. For example, when constructing an expression using a 2-level table to list offices and their employees, the expression 'row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]' does not run properly.
EB: When the user double clicks on the "COUNTRY" column, the expression should automatically insert 'rows[0]["COUNTRY"]'. The index '0' refers to the nested table containing the data set.
SR: To reproduce the issue, open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). Double click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression. Click on "Available Data Sets", choose data set "offices", then double click on the "COUNTRY" column.
